hint: Having the power, skill, or means to do something.
On the subject of; concerning.
Not qualified or diminished in any way; total.
Consent to receive (a thing offered).
A report or description of an event or experience.
Successfully bring about or reach (a desired objective, level, or result) by effort, skill, or courage.
From one side to the other of (a place, area, etc.).
Engaging or ready to engage in physically energetic pursuits.
Existing in fact; typically as contrasted with what was intended, expected, or believed.
The particulars of the place where someone lives or an organization is situated.
Confess to be true or to be the case, typically with reluctance.
Describe or draw attention to (a product, service, or event) in a public medium in order to promote sales or attendance.
Have an effect on; make a difference to.
Have enough money to pay for.
In the time following (an event or another period of time).
The time from noon or lunchtime to evening.
Another time; once more.
In opposition to.
A person who acts on behalf of another person or group.
Have the same opinion about something; concur.
Give (someone) permission to do something.
Not quite; very nearly.
Moving in a constant direction on (a path or any more or less horizontal surface).
Before or by now or the time in question.
Satisfactory but not especially good; acceptable.
In addition; too.
In spite of the fact that; even though.
At all times; on all occasions.
A continent comprising the totality of North and South America.
A quantity of something, especially the total of a thing or things in number, size, value, or extent.
Used to refer to an additional person or thing of the same type as one already mentioned or known.
A thing said, written, or done to deal with or as a reaction to a question, statement, or situation.
Separated by a distance; at a specified distance from each other in time or space.
Clearly visible or understood; obvious.
Come into sight; become visible or noticeable.
Make a formal application or request.
Assign a job or role to (someone).
Come near or nearer to (someone or something) in distance or time.
Suitable or proper in the circumstances.
A region or part of a town, a country, or the world.
Give reasons or cite evidence in support of an idea, action, or theory, typically with the aim of persuading others to share one's view.
Located or situated on every side.
Put (things) in a neat, attractive, or required order.
Connect (someone or something) with something else in one's mind.
Suppose to be the case, without proof.
Be present at (an event, meeting, or function).
The power or right to give orders, make decisions, and enforce obedience.
Able to be used or obtained; at someone's disposal.
Having knowledge or perception of a situation or fact.
To or at a distance from a particular place, person, or thing.
Very bad or unpleasant.
A very young child, especially one newly or recently born.
The rear surface of the human body from the shoulders to the hips.
An even distribution of weight enabling someone or something to remain upright and steady.
A solid or hollow spherical or egg-shaped object that is kicked, thrown, or hit in a game.
The land alongside or sloping down to a river or lake.
The lowest part or edge of something, especially the part on which it rests or is supported.
The underlying support or foundation for an idea, argument, or process.
A large, heavy mammal that walks on the soles of its feet, with thick fur and a very short tail.
Defeat (someone) in a game, competition, election, or other contest.
A combination of qualities, such as shape, color, or form, that pleases the aesthetic senses, especially the sight.
For the reason that; since.
Begin to be.
During the period of time preceding (a particular event, date, or time).
Perform or undergo the first part of (an action or activity).
At or to the far side of (something), typically so as to be hidden by it.
Accept (something) as true; feel sure of the truth of.
An advantage or profit gained from something.
Of the most excellent, effective, or desirable type or quality.
At, into, or across the space separating (two objects or regions).
An amount of money owed for goods supplied or services rendered, set out in a printed or written statement of charges.
The emergence of a baby or other young from the body of its mother; the start of life as a physically separate being.
Of the very darkest color owing to the absence of or complete absorption of light; the opposite of white.
A man; a fellow.
The red liquid that circulates in the arteries and veins of humans and other vertebrate animals, carrying oxygen to and carbon dioxide from the tissues of the body.
Expel air through pursed lips or another opening.
Of a color intermediate between green and violet, as of the sky or sea on a sunny day.
A long, thin, flat piece of wood or other hard material, used for floors or other building purposes.
A small vessel for traveling over water, propelled by oars, sails, or an engine.
The physical structure of a person or an animal, including the bones, flesh, and organs.
A set of written or printed pages, usually bound with a protective cover.
Used to refer to two people or things, regarded and identified together.
Take the trouble to do something.
A container, typically made of glass or plastic and with a narrow neck, used for storing drinks or other liquids.
The lowest part or point of something.
Separate or cause to separate into pieces as a result of a blow, shock, or strain.
Of short duration; not lasting for long.
Exceptionally clever or talented.
Take or go with (someone or something) to a place.
A geographical term which refers to the island containing England, Scotland, and Wales.
A man or boy in relation to other sons and daughters of his parents.
An estimate of income and expenditure for a set period of time.
Construct (something) by putting parts or material together.
A person's regular occupation, profession, or trade.
Having a great deal to do.
An item of soft, sweet food made from a mixture of flour, shortening, eggs, sugar, and other ingredients, baked and often decorated.
Give (an infant or animal) a specified name.
A piece of thick, stiff paper or thin pasteboard, in particular one used for writing or printing on.
The provision of what is necessary for the health, welfare, maintenance, and protection of someone or something.
Support and move (someone or something) from one place to another.
An instance of a particular situation; an example of something occurring.
Intercept and hold (something which has been thrown, propelled, or dropped).
A person or thing that gives rise to an action, phenomenon, or condition.
A monetary unit equal to one hundredth of a dollar, euro, or other decimal currency unit.
The point that is equally distant from every point on the circumference of a circle or sphere.
Able to be firmly relied on to happen or be the case.
A separate seat for one person, typically with a back and four legs.
A person chosen to preside over a meeting.
A possibility of something happening.
Make or become different.
A man or a boy.
The mental and moral qualities distinctive to an individual.
Demand (an amount) as a price from someone for a service rendered or goods supplied.
Low in price, especially in relation to similar items or services.
Examine (something) in order to determine its accuracy, quality, or condition, or to detect the presence of something.
A young human being below the age of puberty or below the legal age of majority.
An act of selecting or making a decision when faced with two or more possibilities.
Pick out or select (someone or something) as being the best or most appropriate of two or more alternatives.
The title, also treated as a name, given to Jesus of Nazareth.
The annual Christian festival celebrating Christ's birth, held on December 25 in the Western Church.
A building used for public Christian worship.
A large town.
State or assert that something is the case, typically without providing evidence or proof.
A set or category of things having some property or attribute in common and differentiated from others by kind, type, or quality.
Free from dirt, marks, or stains.
Easy to perceive, understand, or interpret.
A person or organization using the services of a lawyer or other professional person or company.
A mechanical or electrical device for measuring time, indicating hours, minutes, and sometimes seconds by hands on a round dial or by displayed figures.
Move so as to cover an opening.
Plural of 'close': to move so as to cover an opening or to end a discussion or meeting.
Put clothes on (oneself or someone); dress.
An association dedicated to a particular interest or activity.
A drink made from the roasted and ground bean-like seeds of a tropical shrub, served hot or iced.
Of or at a low or relatively low temperature, especially when compared with the temperature of the human body.
A person with whom one works in a profession or business.
Bring or gather together (things, typically when scattered or widespread).
An educational institution or establishment, in particular one providing higher education or specialized professional or vocational training.
The property possessed by an object of producing different sensations on the eye as a result of the way it reflects or emits light.
Move or travel toward or into a place thought of as near or familiar to the speaker.
A verbal or written remark expressing an opinion or reaction.
Carry out or perpetrate (a mistake, crime, or immoral act).
A group of people appointed for a specific function by a larger group and typically consisting of members of that group.
Occurring, found, or done often; prevalent.
A group of people living in the same place or having a particular characteristic in common.
A commercial business.
Estimate, measure, or note the similarity or dissimilarity between.
Having all the necessary or appropriate parts.
Calculate or reckon (a figure or amount).
Relate to; be about.
Having lived or existed for only a short time.
